title: No Ambulance, Elderly Man Carries Wife On Cart In Madhya Pradesh; She Dies

title: Opinion: Blog | Saraswati Puja, Then And Now: A Reporter's Bhojshala Diary
content: I went to Dhar on a Friday as a reporter with a to-do list: battery checks, mic levels, call-time reminders, and the unspoken rule that you must stand steady even when the ground inside you shifts.

title: T20 WC row explodes: BCB says 'wanted to play' but govt said no to India travel
content: Bangladesh has been removed from the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 after the government refused to grant clearance for the team to travel to India due to security concerns. Despite BCB's attempts to relocate matches, the ICC upheld the original fixtures, leading to Scotland's replacement.

title: Horrific murder in Mumbai local: New CCTV footage shows moment teacher was stabbed to death
content: A college professor was fatally stabbed on a crowded Mumbai local train after a sudden argument at Malad station. CCTV footage captured the attack and helped police swiftly arrest a daily-wage labourer as the accused. The victim, Alok Kumar Singh, was a mathematics and statistics teacher.

title: ‚ÄòAI fuels our global growth, but‚Ä¶‚Äô: Salesforce CEO 'concerned' over AI‚Äôs impact on kids
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff urged immediate AI regulation at the World Economic Forum 2026, warning of potential harm to children. He drew parallels to social media's past failures, emphasizing the need for strict guardrails to protect younger users from AI's "dangerous" and "inaccurate" capabilities, including hallucinations, to prevent a repeat of generational harm.

title: Why Microsoft is asking engineers to test Claude Code alongside GitHub Copilot
content: Microsoft is now having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in AI coding tools, with even non-technical staff encouraged to experiment.  Nvidia's CEO also recently urged engineers to embrace AI coding assistants, highlighting a significant industry shift.

title: Rupee sinks to 92 against US dollar: What's impacted as currency keeps sliding ‚Äî explained
content: The Indian rupee has hit a historic low against the US dollar, making imports like crude oil and electronics pricier for consumers. While this impacts overseas education and travel costs, it offers a silver lining for exporters by increasing their earnings. Experts advise a balanced approach to manage growth and inflation.

title: 'If India keep doing such circus acts': Ashwin's warning amid selection call
content: Former India all-rounder R Ashwin has urged Team India to stay patient with Sanju Samson despite his twin failures against New Zealand. With Ishan Kishan‚Äôs strong knock increasing competition and Tilak Varma set to return, Ashwin warned against frequent changes, saying it could hurt team balance. He backed Samson‚Äôs attacking intent, while Aakash Chopra called the next match crucial for his future.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning; cites 300 leaders trained
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: ‚ÄòTragic farce‚Äô: Amid Bengal SIR, Mamata targets EC over national voters‚Äô day celebrations
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee fiercely criticized the Election Commission on National Voters' Day, calling it a "tragic farce" and accusing it of "destroying democracy on BJP's behalf." She alleged the EC is harassing citizens, particularly vulnerable groups, by demanding physical appearances for verification, leading to distress and deaths.

title: Odia music composer Abhijit Majumdar passes away at the age of 54
content: Odia music composer Abhijit Majumdar, a highly influential figure in Ollywood cinema, has passed away at 54. Battling multiple health issues since September 2025, his condition worsened Saturday night, leading to his demise. Majumdar, who composed over 700 songs, shaped generations of Odia music and his loss is deeply mourned by the industry.

title: ‚ÄòDoesn‚Äôt pass the sniff test‚Äô: Netflix rejects Paramount‚Äôs offer for Warner Bros Discovery
content: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: 'Border 2' BO collection: Sunny Deol's film shows no signs of slowing down
content: Sunny Deol's latest venture, 'Border 2', is taking the cinematic world by storm, enchanting viewers since its release during the Republic Day festivities. With an impressive box office haul topping Rs 80 crore and a remarkable Rs 30 crore on opening day alone, this war epic pays homage to its legendary predecessor while delivering a gripping tale of patriotism.

title: American dreams may have to wait! Why Indians are facing increased US visa refusals
content: Indian visa applicants face significant US processing delays, with increased 221(g) notices for background checks, including social media and old arrest records. This intensified scrutiny, particularly impacting H-1B visa holders, is causing unprecedented delays and even revocations, leaving many stranded.  Biometric requests are also up, extending evaluation times.

title: With father Lalu on stage, Tejashwi named RJD's No. 2; sister Rohini protests
content: ‚ÄãThe appointment coincided with visible signs of internal disquiet within the party. Hours ahead of the RJD‚Äôs national executive meeting in Patna on Sunday, Lalu Prasad‚Äôs daughter Rohini Acharya alleged that the party‚Äôs control had slipped into the ‚Äúhands of infiltrators and conspirators‚Äù whose sole aim, she claimed, was to destroy ‚ÄúLaluvad‚Äù.

title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers weigh move for $26M Kings power trio to upgrade roster
content: NBA trade deadline buzz sees Lakers eyeing a deal with the Kings. The proposed trade, involving Malik Monk, Keon Ellis, and Devin Carter going to LA for Dalton Knecht, Gabe Vincent, and Maxi Kleber, aims to bolster the Lakers' inconsistent bench scoring and defense. Sacramento would gain valuable assets and flexibility.

title: The new layoff era: Work is moving, not disappearing
content: Layoffs often signal a reorganisation of work rather than the end of work itself. The World Economic Forum‚Äôs Future of Jobs Report 2025 projects significant labour-market churn by 2030, with about 170 million roles created and 92 million displaced. Employers also expect major shifts in required skills, increasing the need for upskilling and redeployment as tasks change across industries and functions.

title: 'Why were India allowed?': Former Pakistan coach blasts ICC after Bangladesh World Cup exit
content: Former Australian cricketer Jason Gillespie has criticized the ICC's decision to remove Bangladesh from the 2026 Men's T20 World Cup. He questioned the lack of consistency, drawing parallels to India being allowed to play the 2025 Champions Trophy at a neutral venue due to security concerns in Pakistan. This decision has sparked wider unease within the cricketing community.

title: How India-EU trade pact will cut costs, boost trade ‚Äî explained
content: The India-EU free trade agreement is poised to boost trade and lower costs, according to GTRI. The pact leverages the distinct strengths of both economies, with India excelling in labor-intensive production and the EU in capital goods and technology. This synergy is expected to expand trade rather than harm domestic industries, benefiting producers and consumers alike.

title: After Bangladesh exit, Scotland say 'ready to play', prepare immediate India arrival
content: Cricket Scotland has accepted an invitation from the ICC to replace Bangladesh in the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. The team is preparing to travel immediately to acclimatize and compete on the global stage. This unexpected opportunity arises after Bangladesh's withdrawal due to security concerns.

title: 'I'm upset right now': Djokovic after Sabalenka breaks his Grand Slam record
content: Aryna Sabalenka reached the Australian Open quarterfinals after beating Victoria Mboko 6-1, 7-6. She dominated the match and won her 20th straight Grand Slam tiebreak, breaking Novak Djokovic‚Äôs Open Era record. Djokovic reacted jokingly, saying, "I'm upset right now." Sabalenka, a two-time Australian Open champion, continues her strong run as other top seeds also competed for quarterfinal spots.

title: ‚ÄòInjected HIV virus into doctor‚Äô: Jealous woman attacks ex-lover‚Äôs wife
content: A chilling incident in Kurnool has sparked outrage as four people, including a nurse and her young children, face serious charges after allegedly injecting a doctor with HIV-infected blood. The attack was reportedly motivated by revenge, with the victim being the ex-wife of one of the accused, who was lured into a fabricated accident as part of the sinister plot.

title: 'Evil, corrupt forces won't rule': Vijay targets DMK, AIADMK ahead of 2026 polls
content: TVK chief Vijay on Sunday said that the party has strength and resolves to defeat 'evil and corrupt' forces ahead of Tamil Nadu elections which are scheduled in 2026. During the part meeting, he also launched his party symbol 'whistle'. Vijay who launched the party in 2024 sets TVK as an alternative rival to DMK and AIADMK.

title: Sleeping Hindu man burnt to death in Bangladesh; body charred beyond recognition
content: The man was asleep inside a garage when a fire broke out. While the blaze initially appeared accidental, CCTV footage from the area has raised suspicions of possible foul play. Narsingdi Superintendent of Police Abdullah Al Faruque told ANI that investigators are examining surveillance footage that shows suspicious movement near the site.

title: Meet Simran Bala: First woman from J&K‚Äôs Rajouri to join CRPF; to lead all-male contingent on Jan 26
content: Simran Bala, a 26-year-old Assistant Commandant in the CRPF, will make history by leading an all-male contingent on Kartavya Path this Republic Day. Hailing from a border village in Rajouri, she is the first woman from her district to achieve this feat, inspiring many with her journey of hard work and dedication.

title: Nobel Laureate Roy Glauber says science is guesswork, not perfect logic
content: Roy Glauber, the physicist who won the 2005 Nobel Prize in Physics, challenged a core assumption about how science works. In interviews reflecting on his career, Glauber argued that real scientific breakthroughs rarely emerge from strict deduction. Instead, they grow out of intuition, guesswork, and sustained curiosity. His reflections offer a powerful career lesson for young scientists and educators, questioning how science is taught and how creativity truly enters research.

title: Manali misery: Stranded tourists trek 10-20km with luggage; highway sees 8-km jam
content: Manali is paralyzed by heavy snowfall, with national highways blocked and hundreds of tourists stranded. Accumulations of one to two feet of snow and black ice have halted traffic, forcing many to abandon vehicles and trek through deep snow. Tourists are stuck for over 24 hours in freezing conditions with limited facilities.

title: India-US ties: US delegation 'wraps a productive meeting' with EAM Jaishankar
content: India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met with a US Congressional delegation in New Delhi. Discussions covered India-US relations, the Indo-Pacific, and the Ukraine conflict. The US Ambassador to India also participated. Both sides expressed a desire to strengthen bilateral ties and enhance cooperation. This diplomatic outreach occurs amid ongoing trade talks between the two nations.

title: India's crude basket: More Middle East, less Russia; what's next for Moscow's oil inflows?
content: India is shifting its crude oil sourcing, reducing Russian imports due to compliance risks while increasing shipments from the Middle East. Despite a decline, Russian crude remains a significant, albeit more selective, part of India's energy mix, driven by its economic advantages and refinery margins.

title: Babar, Afridi return as Pakistan announce T20 World Cup squad
content: Pakistan has unveiled their 15-man squad for the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2026, captained by Salman Agha. The 2009 champions, featuring Babar Azam and a strong pace attack led by Shaheen Shah Afridi and Naseem Shah, will face co-hosts India in Group A. Their campaign begins against the Netherlands on February 7 in Colombo.

title: 'Focus on what we can control': Carney defiant as Trump threatens 100% tariff over Canada-China ties
content: Canadian prime minister Mark Carney launched a "Buy Canadian" policy, prioritizing domestic sourcing for national projects. This move follows a threat from US President Donald Trump to impose 100% tariffs on Canadian goods if Ottawa proceeds with trade deals with China, escalating trade tensions.

title: Murder in Mumbai local: Footage shows killer fleeing station after stabbing college teacher to death
content: A college professor was fatally stabbed on a crowded Mumbai local train after a minor argument. CCTV footage captured the accused, a daily-wage labourer, fleeing the scene. The Government Railway Police arrested the suspect within 12 hours of the incident.

title: 'India is not safe for us': BCB's final word as they say 'accept ICC's decision'
content: Bangladesh has accepted the ICC's decision to replace its national team with Scotland in the upcoming T20 World Cup. The Bangladesh Cricket Board cited government advice regarding safety concerns in India as the reason for their refusal to travel. Despite repeated efforts and alternative proposals, the ICC did not agree to relocate Bangladesh's matches.

title: 'They asked our caste': Two jump from 2nd floor of UP cafe to escape Hindu group
content: In a shocking incident in Shahjahanpur, a young couple, aged 21 and 19, made a desperate leap from the second floor of a pizza shop after being confronted by members of a Hindu organization. The couple was reportedly pressed about their castes before being filmed, leading to a panic-induced jump that resulted in serious injuries and hospitalization.

title: An argument that ended in four deaths: What happened inside the Indian home in Georgia
content: A domestic dispute in Georgia, US, tragically ended with an Indian-origin man allegedly killing his wife and three relatives. The couple's three children, who hid during the violence, alerted authorities. The suspect is now in custody facing multiple murder and cruelty charges. The victims have been identified, and the investigation is ongoing.

title: Haryana horror: 1-year-old boy kidnapped and strangled to death by mother‚Äôs Instagram friend
content: A one-year-old boy was allegedly kidnapped and strangled to death in Panchkula, Haryana. The accused, identified as Ajay, was arrested after posing as the child's father to abduct him from a cr√®che. Investigations are ongoing, with the boy's mother also being questioned.

title: Srinagar-Jammu highway shut for third consecutive day amid heavy snowfall; hundreds stranded
content: The vital Srinagar-Jammu national highway remains shut for a third day due to fresh snowfall across Kashmir, stranding hundreds of vehicles. Snow clearance efforts are underway, but ongoing precipitation in Kulgam district is causing delays. Meanwhile, Srinagar city saw light snow, yet flight operations at the international airport continued without disruption.

title: Thief steals phone, sees Premanand Maharaj Ji's photo - Returns it without a word!
content: A smartphone thief experienced a sudden change of heart upon unlocking the stolen device and seeing a spiritual leader's image on the wallpaper. Overcome by the image, the man returned the phone and apologized, a moment captured and shared widely online, sparking discussions about conscience and faith.

title: Tyrese Haliburton breaks silence on Minneapolis fatal shooting of 37-year-old nurse
content: A fatal shooting of a 37-year-old man by a federal immigration officer in Minneapolis led to widespread attention and protests. NBA star Tyrese Haliburton publicly condemned the incident. He issued a blatant statement on social media, sparking mixed reactions from fans. The NBA also postponed a game between the Minnesota Timberwolves and Golden State Warriors due to safety concerns.

title: 'Had a history of drug-related crimes': Dilraj Singh Gill shot dead in Canada, gang rivalry suspected
content: A 28-year-old Vancouver man with known gang links, Dilraj Singh Gill, was fatally shot in Burnaby on Thursday evening. Investigators believe this is part of B.C.'s escalating gang conflict, with a torched vehicle found nearby linked to the killing. Gill had a history of drug-related convictions and alleged ties to a group in conflict with the Brothers Keepers gang.

title: PM Modi urges eligible youth to register as voters during Mann Ki Baat
content: Speaking during the 130th episode of his monthly radio programme Mann Ki Baat, Modi highlighted the significance of the upcoming Republic Day and the constitutional values it represents. He also drew attention to the importance of January 25, which is observed as National Voters‚Äô Day, describing it as a key occasion in the democratic calendar.

title: Railway Budget 2026 expectations: 5 ways to drive growth engine for the Viksit Bharat
content: Railway Budget 2026: Though budgetary support on infrastructure build remains critical, linking these investments to structural reforms will be essential.

title: From 'I Love Drake Maye' to 'Bakemas': Inside the sudden cult celebrity of Drake and Ann Michael Maye
content: the "Get Up" store in westwood, Massachusetts, opened more than a decade before the new England Patriots . the store recently underwent a football-themed makeover . "a-Maye-Zing" window came to life thanks to local artist Joan Aylward .

title: Why feds call former Olympic snowboarder a 'modern-day Pablo Escobar'
content: Ryan Wedding, 44, and his associates allegedly trafficked more than $1 billion in cocaine across the u.s. and Canada . prosecutors laid out how wedding allegedly orchestrated multiple killings, including the assassination of a key government witness . wedding was born into a snow sports family .

title: Takeaways: Gaethje, O'Malley still know how to put on a show
content: Justin Gaethje and Paddy Pimblett go the distance in an incredible main event of UFC 324 . the interim lightweight matchup between two of the toughest fighters in MMA somehow went the distance after five bloody rounds . Sean O'Malley returned to his winning ways against Song Yadong after nearly two years without an Octagon victory .

title: Leicester City? Texas Western? A search for Indiana's best cross-sport comparison
content: the hoosiers were still college football's all-time losingest program in division I . they had never enjoyed a double-digit win season in program history . it took Curt Cignetti virtually no time to reshape the Hoosier .
